Contributor: Morgan, R. G., artist.; Victory Liberty Loan Committee.;
Note: Signed "R.G. Morgan." Date based on date of the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. Orientation: Vertical.
Description: Design for a newspaper and magazine advertisement for the Victory Liberty Loan campaign. The text tells about Marcellus H. Chiles, Captain, 356th Inf., (Deceased), who was honored for gallantry.  Wounded, he turned his command over to the next senior officer, who lead the battalion on to reached their objective.  Americans are asked to show the same spirit and do their duty in the Victory Liberty Loan.  The illustration shows the wounded officer giving orders to his men.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.

Title: America's immortals : Marcellus H. Chiles.
